resources.string:
- The onCreate method is called when the activity is first created.

 - The onStart method is called when the activity becomes visible to the user.

 - The onResume method is called when the activity comes to the foreground and the user can start interacting with it.

 - The onPause method is called when the activity is partially obscured by another activity, like when a dialog is shown.

 - The onStop method is called when the activity is no longer visible to the user. 

 - The onDestroy method is called before the activity is destroyed.

 - We are using Log.d method to log messages indicating when each lifecycle method is called, please check the output in the logcat in Android Studio.
